member.name: T:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.AdvancedOptionsStatus
member.summary:
Status of the advanced options for the specified Elasticsearch domain. Currently, the following advanced options are available:
Option to allow references to indices in an HTTP request body. Must be false when configuring access to individual sub-resources. By default, the value is true. See Configuration Advanced Options for more information.
Option to specify the percentage of heap space that is allocated to field data. By default, this setting is unbounded.
For more information, see Configuring Advanced Options.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.AdvancedOptionsStatus.Options
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Options.
Specifies the status of advanced options for the specified Elasticsearch domain.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.AdvancedOptionsStatus.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Specifies the status of OptionStatus for advanced options for the specified Elasticsearch domain.

member.name: T:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateElasticsearchDomain operation. Creates a new Elasticsearch domain. For more information, see Creating Elasticsearch Domains in the Amazon Elasticsearch Service Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.AccessPolicies
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessPolicies.
IAM access policy as a JSON-formatted string.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.AdvancedOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdvancedOptions.
Option to allow references to indices in an HTTP request body. Must be false when configuring access to individual sub-resources. By default, the value is true. See Configuration Advanced Options for more information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
The name of the Elasticsearch domain that you are creating. Domain names are unique across the domains owned by an account within an AWS region. Domain names must start with a letter or number and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and - (hyphen).

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.EBSOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EBSOptions.
Options to enable, disable and specify the type and size of EBS storage volumes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.ElasticsearchClusterConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ElasticsearchClusterConfig.
Configuration options for an Elasticsearch domain. Specifies the instance type and number of instances in the domain cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainRequest.SnapshotOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotOptions.
Option to set time, in UTC format, of the daily automated snapshot. Default value is 0 hours.

member.name: T:Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.CreateElasticsearchDomainResponse

The status of the newly created Elasticsearch domain.

member.summary:

The status of the Elasticsearch domain being deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.Elasticsearch.AmazonElasticsearchClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Elasticsearch
Amazon Elasticsearch Configuration Service
Use the Amazon Elasticsearch configuration API to create, configure, and manage Elasticsearch domains.
The endpoint for configuration service requests is region-specific: es.region.amazonaws.com. For example, es.us-east-1.amazonaws.com. For a current list of supported regions and endpoints, see Regions and Endpoints.

member.name: M:Amazon.Elasticsearch.AmazonElasticsearchClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonElasticsearchClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

Amazon Elasticsearch Configuration Service
Use the Amazon Elasticsearch configuration API to create, configure, and manage Elasticsearch domains.
The endpoint for configuration service requests is region-specific: es.region.amazonaws.com. For example, es.us-east-1.amazonaws.com. For a current list of supported regions and endpoints, see Regions and Endpoints.

member.name: M:Amazon.Elasticsearch.IAmazonElasticsearch.AddTags(Amazon.Elasticsearch.Model.AddTagsRequest)
member.summary: Attaches tags to an existing Elasticsearch domain. Tags are a set of case-sensitive key value pairs. An Elasticsearch domain may have up to 10 tags. See Tagging Amazon Elasticsearch Service Domains for more information.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AddTags service method.
member.returns: The response from the AddTags service method, as returned by Elasticsearch.
member.exception: An error occurred while processing the request.
The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure (the failure is internal to the service) . Gives http status code of 500.
An exception for trying to create more than allowed resources or sub-resources. Gives http status code of 409.
An exception for missing / invalid input fields. Gives http status code of 400.
